intro: Moerenhoutia leucantha var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered moerenhoutia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a unique and attractive addition to gardens and botanical collections.
